name: Automate Email Triage with GPT-4.1-mini Classification and Gmail Auto-Replies

user.name: Giovanni Beggiato
user.bio: Hi üëã I‚Äôm Gio. I make money with AI automation & teach others how they can too. If you have any questions about my templates or n8n builds, drop them in the comments and I‚Äôll be happy to help.

description:
## How it works:
- Detects new unread Gmail messages
- Extracts sender name for personalized replies
- Classifies the email into one of four categories
- Applies the correct Gmail label and either sends an auto-reply, creates a draft, or logs the contact in Google Sheets

## Setup steps:
- Takes about 5‚Äì10 minutes to connect accounts and set labels
- Connect Gmail, OpenAI, and optional Google Sheets in n8n
- Add label IDs, Google Sheet ID, sheet name, and phone number in Set ‚Äì Config
- Create four Gmail labels for the categories
- Keep full setup instructions in the sticky notes inside the workflow

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

workflow.name: AI-Powered Email Classification and Auto-Reply System with Gmail and GPT

values.content: You are an intelligent and useful personal assistant that replies to my emails

parameters.content:
# Overview

This template triages incoming Gmail in real time using GPT. It extracts the sender‚Äôs name, classifies the message into four categories (Agency Lead, Course Request, Paid Collaborations, Miscellaneous), applies the appropriate Gmail label, and either sends an immediate courtesy reply (for Course Requests and Paid Collaborations) or creates a structured Gmail draft for you to review (for Agency Leads). It also upserts Paid Collaboration contacts into Google Sheets for follow-up.

# Who it‚Äôs for

Solo operators and small teams that get mixed inbound and want consistent, fast triage without living in the inbox. These classification specifically is good for Agencies and Coaches

## How it works / What it does

- Trigger: New unread Gmail message/s
- Name extraction (AI): Pulls the sender name from the email body or signature to personalise replies
- Topic classification (AI): Routes to Agency Lead, Course Request, Paid Collaborations, or Miscellaneous

## Actions:
1. Agency Lead ‚Üí add label and create GPT-draft
2. Course Request ‚Üí add label and auto-reply
3. Paid Collaborations ‚Üí add label, auto-reply, and upsert to Google Sheets
4. Miscellaneous ‚Üí add label only

## Requirements
- Gmail account connected in n8n
- OpenAI credentials
-  Google Sheet for Paid Collaborations with columns: Name, email, subject

## Setup
1. Connect Gmail, OpenAI, and (optionally) Google Sheets credentials in n8n
2. Create four Gmail labels - in my case I created:
    - Agency lead: This includes people/companies interested in inquiries regarding AI solutions, may it be asking info on what they can do, or me building a solution for them.
   - Course Request: This includes inquiries from people regarding which courses they should choose in order to understand/study AI or AI Agents 
   - Paid Collaborations: Inquiries regarding sponsorship of books or tools on my channels. There are also situations in which they don't specifically say that they will pay, but they ask me to share their material with my audience
   - Miscellaneous: the remaining part --> mandatory category to make this work properly.
3. Create a Google Sheet with 3 columns: email, name, email 

## How to customize
- Edit the four categories and their descriptions in the Classify Email Topic (AI) node
- Tweak auto-reply copy in the auto-reply nodes; adjust the GPT draft prompt if needed
- Change the model or temperature in the LLM nodes; extend the Google Sheets schema over time

options.systemPromptTemplate:
=You are an expert extraction algorithm.
Only extract relevant information from the text.
If you do not know the value of an attribute asked to extract, you may omit the attribute's value.

attributes.name: sender_name
attributes.description: =This is the sender name, which corresponds to the signature of the sender at the end of the body of the email. If the name is not available, return an empty string.

categories.description: This includes people/companies interested in inquiries regarding AI solutions, may it be asking info on what they can do, or me building a solution for them.
This includes inquiries from people regarding which courses they should choose in order to understand/study AI or AI Agents

Inquiries regarding sponsorship of books or tools on my channels. There are also situations in which they don't specifically say that they will pay, but they ask me to share their material with my audience
